  • java.lang.Object

      • org.springframework.cloud.dataflow.core.dsl.TaskNode

  • public class TaskNode
extends AstNode
    The root AST node for any entity parsed from task DSL.
    Author:
    Andy Clement

    • Method Detail

      • getTaskPrefix

        public static String getTaskPrefix(String taskName)
        Create the prefix to be added to task names created for task app references in composed task DSL.
        Parameters:
        taskName - the name of the composed task
        Returns:
        a prefix to include ahead of the name/label of an app name

      • stringify

        public String stringify(boolean includePositionInfo)
        Specified by:
        stringify in class AstNode
        Parameters:
        includePositionInfo - position information is returned as a part of the result if set to true.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the AST. Useful for debugging/testing.

      • getTaskApps

        public List<TaskApp> getTaskApps()
        Returns:
        all the apps referenced in the task.

      • accept

        public void accept(TaskVisitor visitor)
        Walk the AST for the parsed task, calling the visitor for each element of interest. See the TaskVisitor for all the events that can be received, since that is an abstract class it can be extended and subclasses only need override methods to receive the events of interest.
        Parameters:
        visitor - a visitor to be called as the AST is walked

      • toGraph

        public Graph toGraph()
        Returns:
        this AST converted to a Graph form for display by Flo

      • validate

        public List<TaskValidationProblem> validate()
        Returns:
        a list of problems found during validation, empty if no problems

      • getName

        public String getName()

      • getTaskText

        public String getTaskText()

      • getStart

        public LabelledTaskNode getStart()
        Shortcut to return the first node in the first sequence. Many tasks will have just one sequence so do not force the consumer to dig through that sequence.
        Returns:
        the first node in the first sequence.

      • getSequences

        public List<LabelledTaskNode> getSequences()

      • getSequenceWithLabel

        public LabelledTaskNode getSequenceWithLabel(String label)
        Find the sequence with the specified label and return it.
        Parameters:
        label - the label to search for
        Returns:
        the sequence with that label or null if there isn't one

      • toDSL

        public String toDSL()
        Returns:
        the DSL representation of this task Ast

      • toExecutableDSL

        public String toExecutableDSL()

      • isComposed

        public boolean isComposed()
        Returns:
        true if the dsl contained more than just a single task app/reference or a single task has transitions

      • getTaskApp

        public TaskAppNode getTaskApp()
        Returns:
        the single task contained in the dsl (for non composed task definitions), or null if it is a composed task
